repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:

Outlined in #30710, currently users need to implement their own solution for showing the language server in the code actions list.

Solution:

This fixes #30710 by adding the language server name next to each
action.

Edit: Update to solution block message for clarity

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -827,11 +830,16 @@ local function on_code_action_results(results, opts)
     return
   end
 
-  ---@param item {action: lsp.Command|lsp.CodeAction}
+  ---@param item {action: lsp.Command|lsp.CodeAction, ctx : lsp.HandlerContext}
   local function format_item(item)
-    local title = item.action.title:gsub('\r\n', '\\r\\n')
-    return title:gsub('\n', '\\n')
+    local title = item.action.title
+    if opts and opts.show_server then
+      local source = vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(item.ctx.client_id).name or "unknown"
+      title = title .. "[" .. source .. "]"

comment_data.body: nit: use format(), it is generally more readable
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -827,11 +827,13 @@ local function on_code_action_results(results, opts)
     return
   end
 
-  ---@param item {action: lsp.Command|lsp.CodeAction}
+  ---@param item {action: lsp.Command|lsp.CodeAction, ctx : lsp.HandlerContext}
   local function format_item(item)
-    local title = item.action.title:gsub('\r\n', '\\r\\n')
-    return title:gsub('\n', '\\n')
+    local source = vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(item.ctx.client_id).name or 'unknown'
+    local title = item.action.title .. ' [' .. source .. ']'

comment_data.body:
arguably redundant if there is only 1 client attached, can we make it conditional?

```lua
local title = ...
local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients({bufnr=ctx.bufnr})
if #clients == 1 then
  return title
end
title = ...
return title
```

@@ -211,7 +211,7 @@ end
 --- Table must contain `start` and `end` keys with {row,col} tuples using
 --- (1,0) indexing.
 --- Can also be a list of tables that contain `start` and `end` keys as described above,
---- in which case `textDocument/rangesFormatting` support is required.
+--- in which case `textDocument/rangesFormatting` support is required.lspbuf

comment_data.body:
Not sure if we really need this fallback, and if 'unknown' is a good one to display. Do we have any particular path where `vim.lsp.Client.name` can be nil? (it's a non-nil field).

Also please prefer `''` instead of `[[ ]]` here because it reads (slightly) better. Q: why do we need a trailing whitespace here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -827,11 +827,14 @@ local function on_code_action_results(results, opts)
     return
   end
 
-  ---@param item {action: lsp.Command|lsp.CodeAction}
+  ---@param item {action: lsp.Command|lsp.CodeAction, ctx : lsp.HandlerContext}
   local function format_item(item)
-    local title = item.action.title:gsub('\r\n', '\\r\\n')
-    return title:gsub('\n', '\\n')
+    local source = vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(item.ctx.client_id).name or 'unknown'
+    return ([[%s [%s] ]]):format(item.action.title, source)

comment_data.body: Also, please update the commit message / title accordingly as we no longer have an boolean option.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -211,7 +211,7 @@ end
 --- Table must contain `start` and `end` keys with {row,col} tuples using
 --- (1,0) indexing.
 --- Can also be a list of tables that contain `start` and `end` keys as described above,
---- in which case `textDocument/rangesFormatting` support is required.
+--- in which case `textDocument/rangesFormatting` support is required.lspbuf

comment_data.body: Trailing whitespace was due to previous impl. `[[%s [%s]]]` is wanted, but trying to do that gave me errors. Using `''` seems to fix this though.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -827,11 +827,14 @@ local function on_code_action_results(results, opts)
     return
   end

   local function format_item(item)

-    return title:gsub('\n', '\\n')
+    local source = vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(item.ctx.client_id).name or 'unknown'
+    return ([[%s [%s] ]]):format(item.action.title, source)

comment_data.body:
is the crlf replacement needed here?
```suggestion
    local title = item.action.title:gsub('\r\n', '\\r\\n'):gsub('\n', '\\n')
```

   local function format_item(item)
-    local title = item.action.title:gsub('\r\n', '\\r\\n')
-    return title:gsub('\n', '\\n')
+    local clients = vim.lsp.get_clients({ bufnr = item.ctx.bufnr })
+    local title = item.action.title

comment_data.body: Thinking ahead I wonder if it would be more flexible to provide a `format_item` callback setting to let users customize each action as their heart desire instead of having a bunch of boolean settings.
Definitely, or even a more generalized solution for overriding handlers. But this PR doesn't add a new boolean flag, it only improves the default behavior.
this isn't a breaking change, please move it below to the LSP section under news-features
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -75,6 +75,8 @@ LSP
   customizing the transformation of an LSP CompletionItem to |complete-items|.
  |vim.lsp.diagnostic.from()| can be used to convert a list of
   |vim.Diagnostic| objects into their LSP diagnostic representation.
+ |vim.lsp.buf.code_action()| actions show client name when there are multiple
+  clients.

comment_data.body: I would be happy to implement this in the current or a future PR (whatever is most appropriate).

comment_regular_data.body:
Why is this an option? When would it be unacceptable to show this?

We can and will try to give full control over presentation through other mechanisms (besides the existing mechanism of overriding the handler). But these micro-options meanwhile should be avoided.

Note the failing CI "lint" check. You can run `make formatlua` locally to fix it.

First PR so just learning the development and design process here. Will fix that formatting issue.

Thought process behind this was the information overload initiating code actions when it came to presentation. 

If we don't want this optional, I'm happy to change it. However I'm wondering how the user might customise this behaviour if they don't want to see the server name, given that the action text and the server text are joined? Would this require a user to fully override `vim.ui.select` in the code action context to remove this?

> information overload initiating code actions

a screenshot would help

> Would this require a user to fully override `vim.ui.select` in the code action context to remove this?

maybe. and if this behavior is reasonable enough, then it's fine that the control freaks have to do some work to override it. 

it depends on what your screenshot reveals... :)
> A screenshot would help Here you are! I actually think I'm changing my mind now I'm looking at this. And here's the full editing context:
screenshot looks fine to me. Add a bit of whitespace to visually separate it.
Would news.txt need to be updated for this kind of change? (sorry if that's a stupid question)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

title: feat(lsp): show server name in code actions
